channel.title: What Happened to Pking Riot World 66
channel.description:
The Pay to Pk Riot (also known as the World 66 Riot) was a that took place in Falador square, World 66, in December 2007. It was a response to the following updates:
* Wilderness Changes, Bounty Hunter and Clan Wars! * Trade and Drop Changes * RuneScape vs Real-world Trading
During the later half of 2007, Jagex had been making many updates to control the macroing and real world trading problems. Updates such as the movement of the Party Room, Lootshare, the Grand Exchange, the assist system, the addition of new random events, and the changes at the Duel Arena had all been designed to stop macroers and real world traders, while at the same time giving players alternative methods of playing that were intended not to hinder gameplay. However, many players felt these update did in fact hurt gameplay.
The tension had been growing, with an increasing anti-Jagex air beginning to surround the forums. When the Behind the Scenes for December was released, some players feared that the removal of the Wilderness would occur, although these were general dismissed as unlikely. Tension was growing greatly between players. On December 10th, Jagex released the updates listed above.
Read More At http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/World_66_Riot

damn i remember the durial riot
i was a lvl 15 runing around scared to death cuz i was confused why me or anyone elce could attack people
i didnt attack everyone thu
[/quote] Get firefox, it has spell check. Anyway, only a few people could attack anyone, not everyone.
im using firefox[/quote]

item.title: What Happened to Pking Riot World 66
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

billygotshot:

jagex could of done nothing you know and people would have switched… i bet the only reason they let it stay is because they didnt know so many people used it.

They could have. But they didn’t. They conceded and slowly made changes that would ruin SS (in-applet world switching, the Grand Exchange, clan chat, etc.). I’d like them to do that with PKing. Keep the fun, but somehow rule out RWT by some other means than utterly removing PKing.

Read full topic
item.source: What Happened to Pking Riot World 66

item.title: What Happened to Pking Riot World 66
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“Dizzy, post:4, topic:165271”][quote author=Not X A Alex link=topic=224279.msg1935042#msg1935042 date=1197847200]
Since when HAVE riots in runescape accompished ANYTHING?

Personally, If I was Gower I would of turned every world off for a few hours, just to say shut the fuck up you ignorant 12 year olds.

I lol’d
[/quote]

The Durial riot (Falador massacre) accomplished many things. :P[/quote]

that was not a riot that was a glitch. and it didnt accomplish anything… other then getting the glitch fixed.

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:11, topic:165271”][quote author=Casey. link=topic=224279.msg1934987#msg1934987 date=1197845797]
Riots will accomplish nothing.
[/quote]

Did the SwiftSwitch riots do nothing? [/quote]

jagex could of done nothing you know and people would have switched… i bet the only reason they let it stay is because they didnt know so many people used it.

Read full topic

The Durial riot (Falador massacre) accomplished many things.
[/quote]
I lol’ed irl. I remember that. The good old days when almost ANYONE could hack Rs. Ahh, good times…good times…but alas, Jagex has fucked up yet again.[/quote] You mean like last year? No one has really ‘hacked’ runescape. Durial found a glitch, not a hack.
